Class AddressFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • AddressFinder

  • public class AddressFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    A Class that is made as an abstraction layer between the library and the application using it. It is meant to make it easier to discover ones global IP address and port.
    Author:
    Frans

      Method that starts a STUN client thread and sends a request to a STUN server through UDP.

    • Method Detail

      • discoverUDPAddress

        public static java.net.InetSocketAddress discoverUDPAddress(java.lang.String stunServerAddress,
                                                            int stunServerPort,
                                                            int clientPort)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Method that starts a stun client thread and sends a request to a STUN server through UDP. Thread safe.
        Parameters:
        stunServerAddress - The IP address to the STUN server the request should be sent to
        stunServerPort - The port to the STUN server the request should be sent to
        clientPort - The port that the client will be using
        Returns:
        The Global IP address and Global Port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - For faulty IP address and DatagramSocket

      • discoverTCPAddress

        public static java.net.InetSocketAddress discoverTCPAddress(java.lang.String stunServerAddress,
                                                            int stunServerPort,
                                                            java.lang.String clientAddress,
                                                            int clientPort)
                                                     throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                            java.io.IOException
        Method that starts a STUN client thread and sends a request to a STUN server through UDP. Thread safe.
        Parameters:
        stunServerAddress - The IP address to the STUN server the request should be sent to
        stunServerPort - The port to the STUN server the request should be sent to
        clientAddress - The IP address that the client will be using
        clientPort - The port that the client will be using
        Returns:
        The Global IP address and Global Port
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - for Socket
        java.io.IOException - for Socket
